comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: WC Osborn, says the original.  If that's right, it's probably William Church Osborn (1862-1951), trained as a lawyer, president of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, among other philanthropic roles in New York City.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Osborn was in the news in March, 1914, as the newly-chosen head of the New York State Democratic Committee. His main task at the time was to work out a mechanism for the party's compliance with the state's recently-enacted primary [election] law, in time for the 1914 elections. New York Times story, March 5, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9F05E3DD1E3AE7...

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: Thanks to all for the research on Mr. Osborn! We will correct and expand the record when we update.
